intro: Cestrum laurifolium f. obovato-orbiculare, commonly known as the broad-leafed cestrum, is a compact shrub native to Mexico. It features glossy, ovate to orbicular leaves that are dark green and slightly waxy in texture. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. These flowers are typically tubular and bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and pleasant fragrance.
